opendial.bn.distribs.other

Class MarginalEmpiricalDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.other.MarginalEmpiricalDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProbDistribution

    public class MarginalEmpiricalDistribution
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProbDistribution
    Distribution defined "empirically" in terms of a set of samples on the relevant variables. The distribution is derived as a marginal distribution on a subset of head and conditional variables.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-13 21:38:32 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • getPosterior

        public IndependentProbDistribution getPosterior(Assignment condition)
                                         throws DialException
        Returns the posterior distribution associated with the empirical distribution given the conditional assignment provided as argument. This posterior distribution is either discrete or continuous (depending on the preferred format for the head variables).
        Specified by:
        getPosterior in interface ProbDistribution
        Parameters:
        condition - the assignment for the conditional variable
        Returns:

      • getValues

        public java.util.Set<Assignment> getValues(ValueRange range)
        Returns the possible values for the head variables of the distribution. For efficiency reason, the input values are ignored, and the distribution simply outputs the head variable values present in the samples.
        Specified by:
        getValues in interface ProbDistribution
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the possible values for the head variables
